column2: Your journey to emulate [Root.GetEmulatedTsarOrPassage] has flourished reccently. People have started to notice your development, and you got some compliments from some [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s too.
Finally, your efforts have paid off. You live like [Root.GetEmulatedTsarOrPassage] in [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], nobody, peasant, noble or [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] could doubt that.
But I can show even more!
In the past few days, you hear laughter behind your back, and you know why. You tried everything, but it seems like you failed to emulate [Root.GetEmulatedTsarOrPassage].
I guess I have a different path.
I just need a little more time.
The past year was uneventful regarding your efforts to emulate [Root.GetEmulatedTsarOrPassage].
I shall focus on something else.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to the ways of Peter the Greatest. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YDiligent§!, §YHonest§! and §YCruel§!, while avoiding their opposites.

[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to the ways of Nicholas the Passion-Bearer. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YContent§!, §YTemperate§! and §YHumble§!, while avoiding their opposites.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to the ways of Ivan the Formidable. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YCruel§!, §YWroth§! and §YParanoid§!, while avoiding their opposites.

[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to the ways of Catherine the Tsarina. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YAmbitious§!, §YLustful§! and §YDeceitful§!, while avoiding their opposites.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to the ways of Alexander the Liberator. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YJust§!, §YKind§! and §YStubborn§!, while avoiding their opposites.

[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to the ways of Alexis the Quietest. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YGregarious§!, §YTrusting§! and §YZealous§!, while avoiding their opposites.
This character successfully emulated Peter the Greatest.
This character successfully emulated Nicholas the Passion-Bearer.
This character successfully emulated Ivan the Formidable.
This character successfully emulated Catherine the Tsarina.
This character successfully emulated Alexander the Liberator.
This character successfully emulated Alexis the Quietest.
This character terribly failed to change [This.GetHerHis] life to the better.
Gained a trait of the emulated tzar or lost its opposite.

Thou Shalt Have No Other Gods Before Me\n[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to this passages. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YZealous§! and §YHumble§!, while avoiding their opposites.

But love your enemies, do good to them, and lend to them without expecting to get anything back. Then your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High, because he is kind to the ungrateful and wicked.\n[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to this passages. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YKind§! and §YCharitable§!, while avoiding their opposites.

Put on the full armor of God, so that you can take your stand against the devil's schemes\n[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to this passages. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YHonest§! and §YBrave§!, while avoiding their opposites.

Or do you not know that your body is a temple of the Holy Spirit who is in you, whom you have from God, and that you are not your own?\n[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to this passages. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YChaste§! and §YTemperate§!, while avoiding their opposites.

Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.\n[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to this passages. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YDiligent§! and §YPatient§!, while avoiding their opposites.

For the word of God is quick, and powerful, and sharper than any two edged sword, piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit, and of the joints and marrow, and a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.\n[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to this passages. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YErudite§! and §YZealous§!, while avoiding their opposites.

O God, give the King your justice, and the king's son your righteousness, so that he may judge your people with righteousness, and your oppressed people with Justice.\n[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to this passages. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YJust§! and §YContent§!, while avoiding their opposites.
Gained a trait of the emulated passage or lost its opposite.

You have been in the library more and more often. You can't stop reading books about how to become a better [Root.Religion.GetName]. But this happens to reduce the time you spend with other important issues.
Knowledge is the only thing that matters.
You have already tried many strange things to improve yourself as a [Root.Religion.GetName]. None of them helped. Today someone mentioned another one. You could wear a cilice.
This torture is for the fools.
Your reccent decision to [Root.GetEmulationAction] wasn't left unnoticed. [emulation_likes.GetTitledFirstName] complimented your behavior multiple times.
I'm doing this for the faith.

Your reccent decision to [Root.GetEmulationAction] wasn't left unnoticed. [emulation_dislikes.GetTitledFirstName] told many of the other courtiers that this isn't the right behavior for a [Root.GetTitle].
I won't embarrass myself like this.
This character follows a trully hurtful religious practice.
This person spends a bit too much time in the library.
Getting better results during the §YEmulate [From.GetEmulatedTsar]§! ambition.

Today an old man requested visit from you. He explained that he was a truely religious person, but also a poor one. He wants to sell you a portrait of [Root.GetEmulatedTsar] that is his only possession.
I will buy it for myself.
I will buy it for the local church.
Nobody have seen him coming in, right?

On a [Root.GetWeatherAdjective] day, while you were thinking about your [Root.GetMatterOfImportance], [Root.GetAReligiousFigure] visits you. He [Root.GetDreamAction] then reminds you about [Root.GetEmulatedTsarOrPassage]. Then you wake up.
This character thinks this emulation is their destiny.
This is a finely made religious portrait of Peter the Greatest.
This is a finely made religious portrait of Nicholas the Passion-Bearer.
This is a finely made religious portrait of Ivan the Formidable.
This is a finely made religious portrait of Catherine the Tsarina.
This is a finely made religious portrait of Alexander the Liberator.
This is a finely made religious portrait of Alexis the Quietest.
